dt: {bc}a barrier preventing the flow of water or of loose solid materials (such as soil or snow)
{bc}a barrier built across a watercourse for impounding {dx_def}see {dxt|impound||2}{/dx_def} water
{bc}a barrier to check the flow of liquid, gas, or air
{bc}a body of water confined by a barrier

et: Middle English, probably from Middle Dutch; akin to Old English for{it}demman{/it} to stop up
shortdef: a barrier preventing the flow of water or of loose solid materials (such as soil or snow); especially, civil engineering : a barrier built across a watercourse for impounding water
a barrier to check the flow of liquid, gas, or air
a body of water confined by a barrier

dt: {bc}to provide or restrain with a barrier that prevents the flow of water {bc}to provide or restrain with a dam {dx_def}see {dxt|dam:1||1a}{/dx_def}

shortdef: to provide or restrain with a barrier that prevents the flow of water : to provide or restrain with a dam

dt: {bc}the female parent of an animal and especially of a domestic animal

shortdef: the female parent of an animal and especially of a domestic animal

dt: {bc}a device attached to the underside of the front of an automobile to improve stability, aerodynamic performance, and engine cooling by redirecting the flow of air

shortdef: a device attached to the underside of the front of an automobile to improve stability, aerodynamic performance, and engine cooling by redirecting the flow of air

dt: {bc}a minimum amount or degree (as of care)

dt.t: didn't give a {it}tinker's damn{/it} about poetry

et: probably from the tinkers' reputation for blasphemy
shortdef: a minimum amount or degree (as of care)
